older pedagogical examples –
Tha mo mhàthair a’ sgrìobhadh litreach gu m’athair a tha air falbh. Thubhairt mo mhàthair, “An téid thu do bhocsa nan litrichean leis an litir seo, Iain?” “Théid,” ars Iain, “falbhaidh mi an dràsda”. “Fuirich gus an dùin mi i is gus an cuir mi seòladh oirre. Ceannaich fhéin stamp agus cuir oirre i.” Tha Iain a’ ruith sìos an rathad leis an litir ’na làimh. Théid e a steach do oifig a’ phuist, ceannaichidh e stamp is cuiridh e sud air an litir. Tilgidh e an litir ann am bocsa nan litrichean.
My mother is writing a letter to my father who is away. My mother said, “Will you go to the postbox with this letter, John?” “Yes, I will,” said John, “I will leave now.” “Wait until I seal it and put an address on it. Buy a stamp and put it on it.” John is running down the road with the letter in his hand. He will go into the post office, he will buy a stamp and put that on the letter. He will toss the letter into the postbox. td. 5–6
Bha an latha brèagha blàth is thug an athair leis Iain agus Anna anns a’ chàr. Chaidh iad sìos taobh an locha is stad iad aig àite bòidheach gorm. Chuir iad an càr a stigh gu taobh an rathaid is thug iad brat a mach as a’ chàr air son suidhe air. Tha bascaid làn de bhiadh aca is tha iad a’ dol a ghabhail an tea air a’ chnocan ghorm. Is toigh leis a’ chloinn biadh a ghabhail a muigh ri latha brèagha. Thèid iad dhachaidh feasgar an uair a tha a’ ghrian a’ dol fodha.
The day was lovely and warm and their father took John and Ann in the car. They went down the side of the lake and they stopped at a beautiful green place. They put the car into the side of the road and they took a blanket out of the car for sitting on. They have a basket full of food and they are going to have their tea on the little green hill. The children like eating al fresco on a nice day. They will go home in the evening when the sun is going down. td. 6–7
examples from Gairm –
Ann an dà bhliadhna dheug sgrìobh e fichead leabhar ’s a h-aon ’s dh’ fhàg e grunn mór phàipearan a chùl air a sin.
In 12 years he [Kierkegaard] wrote 21 books and he left behind a large quantity of papers. td. 103
Bha beagan airgid aige ’s mar sin chaith e a bheatha a’ sgrìobhadh, gun feum aige air obair eile a dhèanamh.
He had a little money and therefore he devoted his life to writing, without the need to do other work. td. 103

biblical examples –
A Nis is iad so ainmeanna chloinn Israeil, a thàinig do’n Eiphit; thàinig gach duine agus a theaghlach maille re Iacob: Reuben, Simeon, Lebhi, agus Iudah, [...] Agus na h-anman uile a thàinig a mach a leasraidh Iacoib, bu deich agus tri fichead anam iad; oir bha Ioseph ’san Eiphit a cheana. [...]
Now these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt; every man and his household came with Jacob. Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, [...] And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: for Joseph was in Egypt already. [...] [KJV] Ecsodus I.1–5

Rugadh am feallsanach Soren Kierkegaard ann sa’ bhliadhna 1813, an Copenhagen far na bhàsaich e nuair a bha e dà fhichead, ’s a dhà.
The philosopher Soren Kierkegaard was born in 1813, in Copenhagen where he died when he was 42. td. 103
